content:
Freshman pitcher Nicole May during the Womens College World Series game against UCLA on June  PERIOD

No PERIOD  Oklahoma  runruled Long Beach State   in five innings in its second game of the Mary Nutter Collegiate Classic on Friday PERIOD

Senior Hope Trautwein started for the Sooners pitching just . innings and allowing three runs on four hits PERIOD She was replaced by sophomore Nicole May who earned the win PERIOD May pitched . innings and allowed no runs on two hits PERIOD

OU was led offensively by senior infielder Jana Johns and sophomore utility Alyssa Brito who both finished with three RBIs PERIOD Senior utility Jocelyn Alo whos one home run away from breaking the NCAA record for career bombs finished 2for2 with a double and two walks PERIOD Junior catcher Kinzie Hansen added two hits and two RBIs and senior infielder Grace Lyons also had two RBIs on one hit PERIOD

In the first inning Hansen ripped a single through the middle of the infield scoring Alo PERIOD Johns and Lyons added tworun homers to cap off a  start for the Sooners PERIOD

Hansen added her second RBI in her next atbat dropping a single into right field PERIOD The Sharks mustered three runs in the third inning cutting the Sooners lead to three PERIOD

With the bases loaded in the fourth inning Brito tripled to left field bringing in junior Riley Boone Alo and Lyons PERIOD Then Johns brought Brito home with a double bringing the score to  PERIOD

Hansen helped bring across another run in the fifth inning when she grounded into a fielders choice scoring sophomore infielder Tiare Jennings PERIOD

The Sooners play their third game of the tournament at  p.m PERIOD CT on Saturday against No PERIOD  Arizona PERIOD
